title: Explain why CHCl3 has a higher boiling point

content.question: <math alttext="C H F 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHF</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> has a normal boiling point of <math alttext="negative 82.1 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>82.1</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C H C l 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> has a normal boiling point of <math alttext="61.2 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>61.2</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>. Which of the following best helps to explain why <math alttext="C H C l 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> has a higher boiling point?

choices.label: <math alttext="C H C l 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> has dipole-dipole forces, but <math alttext="C H F 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHF</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> does not.

<math alttext="C H C l 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> experiences hydrogen bonding, but <math alttext="C H F 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHF</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> does not.

<math alttext="C H C l 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> has stronger London dispersion forces than <math alttext="C H F 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHF</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> does.

<math alttext="C H C l 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>has stronger covalent bonds than <math alttext="C H F 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHF</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> does.

content.answer: <math alttext="C H C l 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHCl</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> has stronger London dispersion forces than <math alttext="C H F 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CHF</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> does.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
